titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 272: Laylī va Majnūn.

msContents.summary: Acephalous copy of the story of Layli and Majnun told in verse; this copy begins with the third line of section "Shawq-i Nawfal bi-khiyāl-i Majnūn".

persName.#text: Kirmānī, Muḥammad Jaʻfar ibn Muḥammad Rafīʻ
كرماني، محمد جعفر بن محمد رفيع.

supportDesc.extent: 44 unnumbered leaves : 145 x 80 (105 x 55) mm, bound to 145 x 80 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 13 lines in two columns; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻlīq in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Textblock border ruled in pink and blue with page-opening ruled in pink. Interlinear gold wash to resemble cloudbands probably added by a later hand; it partially obscures the titles in some instances. Titles in red.

binding.p: Brown leather with blind stamped oblong cartouche and blind tooled frame.

origin.p: Item is dated 1236 AH and was copied by Muḥammad Jaʻfar ibn Muḥammad Rafīʻ Kirmānī (f. 43r)

provenance: Formerly owned by George Arthur Plimpton (bookplate inside front cover).
